snippet: As Marco Saavedra, who was brought to the United States as a toddler, seeks to change immigration law, his parents, despite their own unauthorized status, are supporting him.
abstract: Side Street column; Antonio Saavedra and Natalia Mendez, parents of immigrant reform activist Marco Saavedra, say they support their son's act of civil disobedience despite their own unauthorized status; Saavedra, one of nine young men and women calling themselves Dreamers, spent two weeks in Arizona immigration jail after attempting to re-enter United States from Mexico.
lead_paragraph: As Marco Saavedra, who was brought to the United States as a toddler, seeks to change immigration law, his parents, despite their own unauthorized status, are supporting him.

headline.main: United Behind a Son’s American Dream, No Matter the Consequences
headline.print_headline: United Behind a Son’s American Dream, No Matter the Outcome
